results.title: The Quiet family
results.creator_credit: Mari Kim and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description: This 2D tale of horror has an unexpected twist to it - all is not what it seems! An Addams type of family deals with the consequences of having their little darling make friends with the rest of the world. Mainly b&w with splashes of colour. Hand-drawn animation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mari Kim and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.description: This 2D tale of horror has an unexpected twist to it - all is not what it seems! An Addams type of family deals with the consequences of having their little darling make friends with the rest of the world. Mainly b&w with splashes of colour. Hand-drawn animation.

results.title: Home of the behemoth
results.creator_credit: Eddie Wong and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description: A trip back in time with this “silent” animated b&w cartoon. You can even hear the clicking noise of the projector. Hand-drawn animation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eddie Wong and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

results.title: Laughing and crying
results.creator_credit: Tang Yang and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Disturbing circus tale of death and betrayal and the tragedy that lies behind the laughing mask of the clowns.
Hand-drawn animation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tang Yang and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

results.title: The Kite
results.creator_credit: Ami Chew and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description: A fascinating animated work which uses string and buttons and other materials to create a sympathetic and likable character whose dream is to free a kite caught up in a tree on the top of a hill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ami Chew and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

results.title: Bonely angel
results.creator_credit: Patsarun Chuthapisit and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description: This macabre “fractured fairytale” of a lost and lonely angel is most entertaining with its twisted sense of humour and storybook presentation. Uses hand-drawn animation and beautiful pastel colours.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patsarun Chuthapisit and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

results.title: Jettison
results.creator_credit: Adrian Rose and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description: Abstract shapes, distorted figures jettison on and off the screen metamorphosing to the rhythmic beat of “The Deadly art of knowledge” by Chris MacKellar. A vibrant celebration of the potential of animated forms to constantly move, change and surprise. Obtained an Honourable Mention in the Australian Panorama section of Australian International Animation Festival
results.creator_credit_for_label: Adrian Rose and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

results.title: Fish
results.creator_credit: Hafiz Zamri and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description: An allegorical tale of struggle and survival in a competitive world. Filmed in black and white this rather tragic story contains some disturbing scenes. Uses hand-drawn animation, music soundtrack and no commentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hafiz Zamri and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

results.title: Ratio of fire
results.brief_description:
Superb 3D animation illustrates the concept of ‘ratio of fire’ in modern warfare.
WARNING: Some scenes may disturb some viewers

Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2004.
